title: Artist Marketing Manager
content:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is a world famous brand with offices across the globe. Within Fender Musical Instruments Corporation’s ("FMIC") China marketing team, we will connect the culture and product legacy of Fender with Chinese consumers and musicians, support them at every stage of their music career.
An American icon, Fender was born in Southern California and has built a worldwide influence extending beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument, it’s a cultural symbol that resonates globally.
We are searching for an Artist Marketing Manager based Shanghai. This position will be responsible of maintain and develop the network of artists, musicians and producers for FMIC brand and its products.
Essential Functions: 

Develop 3-year-strategic plan for Fender China Artist Marketing, including: number of artists, genre, tier, supporting program & KPI.
Maintain existing artist relationships, explore, and recruit new relationships to Fender family.
Closely collaborate with brand marketing and ecommerce to identify key artists for brand campaigns, events, content, social and ecommerce initiatives. Contribute authentic creative input from artist perspective.
Develop artist product programs, including but not limited to artist signature products, artist mod-shop, artist seeding and artist purchase program. Support artists with their product requirements.
Establish, manage and build an effective, on-going, artist feedback process on products to deepen Fender China’s understanding of professional user experiences, product concepts, strategies and overall brand positioning efforts.
Own and drive the Fender China Artist Marketing dashboard including weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting of activation, stage presence, social media exposure/performances and other presentations and reports as needed.
Close communication with US, EMEA, APAC artist marketing teams to localize artist content, support global artists’ China tour/performance/appearances.
Lead annual Fender Next Campaign from China side.
Collaborate with operation marketing manager to plan and manage artist seeding inventory & artist marketing budget.
Additional duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

5+ years’ experience in similar role for China relevant, consumer-driven brands and/or agencies in Music, Lifestyle, Fashion/Luxury Goods and/or Media.
Experienced and comfortable of communicating with artist and musicians directly with professional manner
Expert level knowledge and passionate about Fender brand and products. A guitar and/or bass player.
Ability to effectively work with artists, business team, product team, and vendors. Capability of juggling a multitude of tasks with varying deadlines. Ability to prioritize work and adapt to changing priorities.
Language: Full bilingual capability both in English and Chinese.
Education: University Degree required; bachelor’s degree in advertising, marketing, design or a related field or the equivalent level of experience preferred.

 
About Fender Musical Instruments:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation (FMIC) is one of the world’s leading musical instrument manufacturers, marketers and distributors, whose portfolio of brands includes Fender®, Squier®, Presonus®, Gretsch®, Jackson®, EVH®, Charvel®, Bigsby®, and Groove Tubes®, among others. For more information, visit www.fender.com. Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, disability, veterans’ status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor.

questions.label: Are you legally authorized to work in the country you are applying?
Will you now or in the future require immigration sponsorship for employment visa status?
Do you have  Chinese and English language fluency?
How did you hear about us?
If Referral or Other please specify:

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS CAREFULLY: The information I've provided on this application is accurate to the best of my knowledge and subject to verification. Any misrepresentation or deliberate omission of fact in my application will be justification for refusal to employ me or for termination of my employment by Fender Music Corporation. If employed, I shall sign the Code of Conduct stating the non-compete/confidentiality agreement, if applicable, in which I will agree to protect Fender Music Corporation's confidential information. If employed, I understand that Fender Music Corporation is an "at will" employer, in that employment is terminable at the will of the company or me at any time, with or without notice, and for any lawful reason, or no reason. I understand that, if employed, I must at all times comply with Fender Music Corporation's standards of work performance and business conduct. Failure to do so can result in my release without notice or severance pay. I authorize Fender Music Corporation to obtain information about me from my previous employers and schools.

values.label: I confirm I have read, understand, and agree to the statement above.
